body_html:
@reedwm @gunan cocos2d-x is a cross-platform gaming engine based on C++, for Android we have to build cocos2d-x library source and c++ classes with NDK, and to add prebuilt libraries we simply put in a directory and let android.mk know about it.
the problem arises when we try to build app with NDK it successfully able to detect the prebuilt library, and compile classes (contains tensor.h), but throws the above error.

The reason according to my understanding might be

either the eigen is not supported or has issue with android
either the prebuilt eigen is not compatible with native android NDK.

can you please look into this issue, I have to deliver this app soon

body:
@reedwm @gunan cocos2d-x is a cross-platform gaming engine based on C++, for Android we have to build cocos2d-x library source and c++ classes with NDK, and to add prebuilt libraries we simply put in a directory and let android.mk know about it.
the problem arises when we try to build app with NDK it successfully able to detect the prebuilt library, and compile classes (contains tensor.h), but throws the above error.

The reason according to my understanding might be
> either the eigen is not supported or has issue with android 
> either the prebuilt eigen is not compatible with native android NDK. 

can you please look into this issue, I have to deliver this app soon
